name: Paladin Ramos

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: You'll find your equipment in the chest to your right. Don't bother coming back until you've dealt with the ranger.

topics.topic_text: Got anything you need help with?
topics.response_text: Bored already? You should try living down here. Sorry, but I don't really have- oh, for Pete's sake, not again.

topics.topic_text: How do I join the Brotherhood of Steel?
topics.response_text: You don't. Ever. You don't even think about it.

topics.topic_text: I'll speak to your Elder. Lead the way.
topics.response_text: Okay. I'll take you to him. Follow me. Closely. Or you'll be shot.

topics.topic_text: Hello?
topics.response_text: [You hear nothing.]

topics.topic_text: The password is "Lives to fight another day."
topics.response_text: {Thinks you're from one of the lost patrols}[You hear static.]

topics.topic_text: Sorry, I just wandered in here. I'm lost.
topics.response_text: Yes. Permanently, I'm afraid.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about what happened at HELIOS.
topics.response_text: I'm sure someone's told you all this before. Several years back, we were running our chapter out the HELIOS One solar power station.

topics.topic_text: I found some of your people dead out in the waste. They had it on them.
topics.response_text: An interesting story. It may even be true.

topics.topic_text: Why do you look so spooked?
topics.response_text: The password you gave is valid, but old. The only way you could have gotten it is from one of our lost patrols.

topics.topic_text: Who are you?
topics.response_text: I'm the one asking the questions right now, and you still haven't answered me. I suggest you start doing so.

topics.topic_text: Could you just let me go? I really don't care what's down here anymore.
topics.response_text: That's no longer an option, on account of you having one of our passwords. Now if you'd stop stalling, I'd really like to know where you learned it.

topics.topic_text: The password is "And to dare to do it."
topics.response_text: {Thinks you're from one of the lost patrols}[You hear static.]

topics.topic_text: I appear to be lost. I'll just head back the way I came in.
topics.response_text: Not on my watch you won't. You either go with me to the Elder or I put you in the ground right here. Choose.

topics.topic_text: I'm not going anywhere with you.
topics.response_text: {Sighs}Your call.

topics.topic_text: So you're head of security?
topics.response_text: That's right. Nothing gets in or out of here without me knowing it.

topics.topic_text: So why did I have to deal with that Ranger topside?
topics.response_text: Normally, that would have fallen under my jurisdiction, but the Elder thought it'd provide a good test for you, so I backed off.

topics.topic_text: Did you know Watkins and Stanton snuck out of here a few weeks ago?
topics.response_text: {Laughs}Yeah, I knew about it. They're still young, and they weren't going to go very far.

topics.topic_text: What exactly are the rules regarding entering and leaving?
topics.response_text: Under the lockdown, only essential personnel are permitted to enter or leave. That includes supply runners and high security patrols.

topics.topic_text: I had other questions.
topics.response_text: Fine by me.

topics.topic_text: What would an Elder have to do to get kicked out?
topics.response_text: So you've been talking to Hardin, eh? He's been looking for a way to usurp McNamara ever since the lockdown started.

topics.topic_text: The password is "The better part of valor."
topics.response_text: {Thinks you're from one of the lost patrols}[You hear static.]

topics.topic_text: One of the datastore entries mentioned the Chain That Binds. What is that, exactly?
topics.response_text: That's an old, old principle that's been around since the Brotherhood was founded. It basically means that you have to obey a superior officer.

topics.topic_text: Who is Elijah?
topics.response_text: Who{emph}was Elijah, more like. He was our Elder before McNamara. Bright guy, but just between you and me he was a little off.

conversation.response_text: Great, looks like they're going at it again.
Give it a few moments. This won't take long, trust me.
You'll find your belongings in the chest to your right. Don't come back until you've dealt with the ranger.
We gave you a password, Veronica. It's for your safety.

description:
Paladin Ramos is a 45 year-old Hispanic Male.

A senior member of the Mojave Chapter of the Brotherhood of Steel, Ramos serves as the head of security for the Hidden Valley bunker. He is a veteran of Operation Sunburst and carries the weight of his experiences with solemn determination.

Paladin Ramos's Personality: Diligent, security-focused, and rigid in his duties. Ramos is detail-oriented and takes his responsibility to protect the Brotherhood seriously. While not heartless, he is uncompromising when it comes to the Brotherhood's protocols and safety. He harbors deep resentment toward Elder Elijah for his leadership failures.

Paladin Ramos's Backstory: Born in the ruins of California, Ramos was recruited into the Brotherhood of Steel at a young age. He proved himself during Operation Sunburst, where he survived both the NCR's siege and Elder McNamara's desperate counter-offensive. His valor during these conflicts earned him his promotion to Senior Paladin and the position of head of security. Ramos witnessed firsthand the consequences of Elijah's poor leadership and has since become a staunch defender of the Brotherhood's isolationist policies in the Mojave.
